bib.title: Considering territorial governance mechanisms as a shared resource
bib.author: Marc Piraux and Jean-Philippe Tonneau
bib.abstract: Today, in the Global North and South, the territory appears to be the preferred level at which to respond to the challenges of sustainable development. Many states thus renew their public action at the territory level. This was the case in Brazil between 2003 and 2016. Territorial governance mechanisms play an important role in organizing collective action between multiple actors, but problems and questions arise concerning how they function. The article analyzes how territorial governance arrangements that mobilize the notion of shared resources and collaborative strategies largely respond to these difficulties. Action research carried out in Brazil over a period of fifteen years has analyzed the key elements of the collaborative approach that have made it possible to construct these arrangements in common.
